Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Gladiator \Glad"i*a`tor\, n. [L., fr. gladius sword. See {Glaive}.] 1. Originally, a swordplayer; hence, one who fought with weapons in public, either on the occasion of a funeral ceremony, or in the arena, for public amusement. [1913 Webster]
2. One who engages in any fierce combat or controversy.
gladiator n 1: (ancient Rome) a professional combatant or a captive who entertained the public by engaging in mortal combat 2: a professional boxer [syn: {prizefighter}]
